We're proud to work alongside the infectious diseases community to combat the problem of #antimicrobialresistance by building a global antimicrobial surveillance system. What could this mean for hospital health worldwide? #AMR #ESBLs #PAeruginosa

AFib can be detected in various ways, but a pulse check in at-risk patients can be a vital first step in diagnosing the condition. Since some patients may be asymptomatic, be mindful of #AFib risk factors and perform patient assessments as appropriate.

In 2021, ~8.7 million people in the US are projected to have #AFib, and this number is expected to grow as the US population ages. It‚Äôs important to be mindful of AFib risk factors since there is an increased stroke risk associated with the condition.
Some #AFib patients can be asymptomatic, so it‚Äôs critical to be mindful of their risk factors given the increased stroke risk associated with the condition.
Do you know which of your patients are at risk for #AFib? A pulse check in at-risk patients as part of an assessment can be a critical first step towards diagnosing and managing the condition.

AFib is the most common cardiac rhythm disturbance. Based on a survey of 1,010 US adults conducted on behalf of the BMS/Pfizer Alliance, the majority were not familiar with #AFib. Since some patients may be asymptomatic, it‚Äôs important to discuss AFib with those who are at risk.
As #AFib prevalence is projected to grow, it‚Äôs critical to assess your patients at risk for AFib and discuss the signs, symptoms and risk factors with them through in-person or telehealth visits.

There is an increased risk of stroke associated with atrial fibrillation or #AFib. In honor of #StrokeMonth, pay close attention to common AFib symptoms, including heart racing or shortness of breath. If experiencing symptoms that could be due to AFib, talk to a doctor.

If you‚Äôre experiencing leg pain, swelling, or redness, these symptoms could be signs of deep vein thrombosis (#DVT) or another medical condition. Only a doctor can make a proper diagnosis.

Even though you may have reasons for waiting to go to your doctor right now, if you‚Äôre experiencing symptoms like leg pain, swelling or redness, take the time to discuss these symptoms with your doctor, as they could be signs of deep vein thrombosis (#DVT).

If you‚Äôre experiencing symptoms like shortness of breath, fatigue or light-headedness, don‚Äôt wait to contact your doctor. These symptoms could be a sign of atrial fibrillation, or #AFib, which is the most common type of irregular heartbeat and is a potentially serious condition.

#WorldHeartDay is Sept 29! #DYK ATTR-CM is a rare cause of heart failure? It occurs when a normal transport protein becomes unstable and misfolds ‚Äì creating amyloid fibrils. These fibrils can build up in the heart, causing heart failure.
